==Applies To==
* iOS applications that handle sensitive data.
==What to Do==
Do not cache sensitive data in temporary files.
==Why==
Data from temporary files may be recovered by an attacker if the device is lost or compromised.
==How==
To prevent caching of sensitive data:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the application source code to find functions that are responsible for creating the temporary files. Check if any of these functions write sensitive data. # **Remove code that writes sensitive data to temporary files.** Edit the functions that write sensitive data to temporary files to prevent caching of sensitive data.
